ARABIC: لَّا يَمْلِكُونَ ٱلشَّفَٰعَةَ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ عَهْدًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They have no right of intercession. None do but those who have a contract with the All-Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: None will have power to intercede for them except one who obtains a promise from Ar-Rahman.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: On that Day none will have the power to intercede for them except those who received a sanction from the Most Compassionate Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: no one will be able to intercede for the others except those whom the Beneficent God has given authority.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: People do not own the right to intercede, except those* who have made a covenant with the Most Gracious. (* The Holy Prophets and virtuous people will be given the permission to intercede. Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him – will be the first to intercede.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from the Most Gracious (Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They shall not control intercession, save he who has made a covenant with the Beneficent Allah.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: having no power of intercession, save those who have taken with the All-merciful covenant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They will have no power of intercession, save him who hath made a covenant with his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: No one will have power to intercede, except for those who have permission from the Lord of Mercy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They shall not own intercession, excepting those who have taken of the Compassionate a covenant. *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: no one will have the power to intercede [with Allah], except for him who has taken a covenant with the All-beneficent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from the Most Beneficent (Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: who have no power of intercession, except those who have taken a covenant with the Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They will have no power of intercession, except for someone who has an agreement with the Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:87] They, namely, mankind, will not have the power to intercede, save him who has made a covenant with the Compassionate One, [the covenant being] the profession of lā ilāha illā’Llāh wa-lā hawla wa-lā quwwata illā bi’Llāh, ‘there is no god but God, and there is no power or strength except in God’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They will have no power of intercession) the angels will not intercede for anyone, (save him who hath made a covenant with his Lord) through the attestation of "there is no deity except Allah".
